kit101

Class Balloon

  • java.lang.Object
    • kit101.Balloon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Balloon
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Simulates (poorly) the behaviour of a hot air balloon.

    This is based on an idea from a C++ textbook written by Astrachan.

    Usage: Instantiate Balloon objects, e.g.,

     Balloon b1;
 b1 = new Balloon();

    Height and duration can be set directly by the client, as in 

     b1.setAltitude(40);
 b1.setDuration(20);
    or prompted and set by the Balloon itself, as in 
    b1.setUp();

    Once height and duration are set the "flight" can be under direct client control, as in 

     b1.ascend();
 b1.cruise();
 b1.descend();
    or done by the Balloon, as in 
     b1.beginFlight();
 b1.waitForLanding();

    NOTE: If starting a flight with beginFlight() then each Balloon "runs" in its own thread of execution, so if there is more than one Balloon they will operate independently.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Balloon()
      The Balloon constructor: creates a new Balloon with default settings: debugging == false currentAltitude == 0 timeElapsed == 0 safetyMargin == 5 identifier "Balloon number n" (n is number of Balloons that exist)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ascend()
      Simulates ascent to the required altitude (assumes it has been set); reports progress every "burn"
      void beginFlight()
      Starts the Balloon's flight (and its execution thread).
      void cruise()
      Simulates cruise for the duration required (assumes it has been set) progress is reported every "time step"
      void debug(java.lang.String message)
      Dumps the given message to stderr, if debug mode is on.
      void descend()
      Simulates descent to ground level (altitude 0); reports progress every release of gas.
      void haltFlight()
      Causes the flight (really, the execution thread) to be interrupted immediately, without the Balloon landing.
      boolean isDebugging()
      Returns true if debugging messages will be displayed, false otherwise.
      void run()
      Causes the Balloon to ascend/cruise/descend according to the height and duration previously set; called automatically when the thread's start() method is called in beginFlight().
      void setAltitude(int alt)
      Sets altitude for the flight.
      void setDebugging(boolean db)
      Turns debugging messages on or off.
      void setDuration(int time)
      Sets during for the flight.
      void setIdentifier(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the identifier for this Balloon; replaces the default name generated in the constructor.
      void setSafetyMargin(int m)
      Sets safety margin (amount by which altitude is allowed to vary without adjustment).
      void setUp()
      Prompts and accepts values for height and duration of the flight (expects integers for both).
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representation of this Balloon, which includes an identify number.
      void waitForLanding()
      Pauses execution in the caller until the flight has concluded normally (i.e., the balloon as ascended, cruised and descended).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Balloon

        public Balloon()
        The Balloon constructor: creates a new Balloon with default settings:
        • debugging == false
        • currentAltitude == 0
        • timeElapsed == 0
        • safetyMargin == 5
        • identifier "Balloon number n" (n is number of Balloons that exist)

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
        Prompts and accepts values for height and duration of the flight (expects integers for both). No checking for reasonableness of values is performed.

      • beginFlight

        public void beginFlight()
        Starts the Balloon's flight (and its execution thread). Is ignored if the Balloon flight has already begun.

      • waitForLanding

        public void waitForLanding()
        Pauses execution in the caller until the flight has concluded normally (i.e., the balloon as ascended, cruised and descended).

      • haltFlight

        public void haltFlight()
        Causes the flight (really, the execution thread) to be interrupted immediately, without the Balloon landing.

      • setAltitude

        public void setAltitude(int alt)
        Sets altitude for the flight. The given value is not checked for reasonableness.
        Parameters:
        alt - - altitude for this Balloon's flight in whole metres

      • setDuration

        public void setDuration(int time)
        Sets during for the flight. The given value is not checked for reasonableness.
        Parameters:
        time - - time of this Balloon's flight in arbitrary time units

      • setIdentifier

        public void setIdentifier(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the identifier for this Balloon; replaces the default name generated in the constructor.
        Parameters:
        name - - the new identifier for this Balloon.

      • setSafetyMargin

        public void setSafetyMargin(int m)
        Sets safety margin (amount by which altitude is allowed to vary without adjustment).
        Parameters:
        m - - safety margin

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this Balloon, which includes an identify number.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • run

        public void run()
        Causes the Balloon to ascend/cruise/descend according to the height and duration previously set; called automatically when the thread's start() method is called in beginFlight(). Note that there is no check to see that height and duration have been set.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • ascend

        public void ascend()
        Simulates ascent to the required altitude (assumes it has been set); reports progress every "burn"

      • descend

        public void descend()
        Simulates descent to ground level (altitude 0); reports progress every release of gas.

      • cruise

        public void cruise()
        Simulates cruise for the duration required (assumes it has been set) progress is reported every "time step"

      • debug

        public void debug(java.lang.String message)
        Dumps the given message to stderr, if debug mode is on. Message is tagged with this Balloon's string representation.

      • setDebugging

        public void setDebugging(boolean db)
        Turns debugging messages on or off.

      • isDebugging

        public boolean isDebugging()
        Returns true if debugging messages will be displayed, false otherwise.
